Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: This disease is caused by bacteria. It appears as small, water-soaked spots on the leaves, which later turn black and develop a yellow halo.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plant parts immediately.
Apply copper-based fungicides or bactericides as a protective spray.
Avoid overhead watering; water at the base of the plant.
Ensure good air circulation around the plants.

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Caused by a fungus, this disease presents as dark, concentric 'target' spots on lower, older leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Mulch at the base of the plant to prevent fungus from splashing from the soil.
Rotate crops and avoid planting tomatoes in the same spot for at least two years.

Tomato___healthy.description: Your plant appears to be healthy and free of common diseases.
treatment: Monitor regularly for any signs of pests or disease.
